clinical_study.brief_title: A Study on the Clinical and Psychological Characteristics of Patients With COVID-2019
clinical_study.official_title: A Study on the Clinical and Psychological Characteristics of Patients With COVID-2019

brief_summary.textblock: A study on the clinical and psychological characteristics of patients with coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-2019)

detailed_description.textblock: The main objective of this study is to study the clinical and psychological responses of patients with COVID-2019 during the whole treatment process. Including clinical symptoms, auxiliary examination results, and corresponding psychological changes, including depression, anxiety, insomnia, etc. This study will draw lessons about treatment and other better advices for other countries and regions.

primary_outcome.description: The fever is one main clinical characteristics of patients with COVID-2019, Measured by thermometer. 37.2-38 degrees Celsius, low fever; 38-39 degrees Celsius, moderate fever; 39-40 degrees Celsius, high fever.

secondary_outcome.description: Cough is one main symptom of patients with COVID-2019. "Yes" or "no" would be recorded.
Diarrhea is one symptom of some patients with COVID-2019. "Yes" or "no" would be recorded.

Anxiety is one main psychological characteristic of patients with COVID-2019. It would be assessed by Hamilton anxiety scale (HAMA). Scores of HAMA were positively correlated with the severity of anxiety.

Insomnia is one main psychological characteristic of patients with COVID-2019. It would be assessed by Athens insomnia scale (AIS). Scores of AIS were positively correlated with the severity of insomnia.

Depression is one psychological characteristic of patients with COVID-2019.It would be assessed by Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HAMD) . Scores of HAMD were positively correlated with the severity of depression.

arm_group.description: Patients with COVID-2019 would be observed.

intervention.description: All patients with COVID-2019 would receive treatment provided by the government and should comply with relevant laws and regulations.

study_pop.textblock: All patients with COVID-2019 would be observed.
